I call on the FDA to reverse its decision immediately and allow Battelle to operate at maximum capacity.

At a time when every single piece of PPE & durable medical equipment is critical, red tape shouldn't be holding up the safe and sterile re-use of it is shocking, especially not when this very process has been in development at Battelle in conjunction with the FDA since 2015.
Limiting the sterilization process to the Columbus facility doesn’t make any sense when they have the capacity to deploy sterilization equipment where it is needed most.

The @US_FDA decision to limit @Battelle's PPE sterilization process is outrageous and another example of an unaccountable bureaucracy run amok. The FDA’s restrictions cripple Battelle to little more than 6 percent of their capacity.
Unfortunately, this could have been done earlier this week if partisan grandstanding & attempts to force progressive agenda items into essential legislation had not needlessly delayed it.
It is incumbent upon Congress to support those fighting to stop the spread of the coronavirus & the millions of Americans suffering from loss of work. The CARES Act does exactly that.

I have always said that when Americans face a national challenge, we will rise to the occasion. Everyone is stepping up, doing what they can, from healthcare workers & first responders to workers in critical infrastructure sectors.
The CARES Act is a critical phase 3 in the federal response to the coronavirus outbreak. By beefing up funding directly to hospitals, they can ramp up the capacity to diagnose and treat patients.
Congress is continuing to surge funding & resources to our hospital systems & provide financial stability for American families & small businesses during unstable & unprecedented times.
